column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=If you look at what Obama said , it was n't even progressive .
#Text=All he said was this is my personal statement .
#Text=He did n't say that North Carolina was wrong [ for passing a ban on same-sex marriage ] .
#Text=You have to read the tealeaves when this guy talks .
#Text=All the guy said was I think that gay marriage is fine with me personally .
#Text=He did n't say that we 're going to make a federal law that makes it incumbent upon the states not to outlaw it .
#Text=He did n't do that .
#Text=He 's fine with those kind of laws .
#Text=He 's not going to go out there and do any more than say what he said .
#Text=So he did n't give us an agenda like :
#Text=are you going to go ahead and have it where you 're going to have a situation , are you going to allow homosexual or same-sex couples to go ahead and have tax deductions ?
#Text=Are you going to allow them to have the same kind of income tax return as a traditional family ?
#Text=He did n't go through all that .
#Text=He just made a general statement .
#Text=Now he 's off the floor as some kind of Caesar ; someone vindicating the rights of gay people .
#Text=His statement was very vague .
#Text=It 's just very Obama-like .
#Text=He did n't really commit to anything .
#Text=He just said that was his personal opinion .
#Text=Well , personally , do you believe it is a federal or state issue ?
#Text=I think it 's a state issue .
#Text=But I think it 's something that I need to study more because I 'm a person really that tries to get beyond identity politics .
#Text=I 'm interested mostly in three things .
#Text=My interests are :
#Text=number one , the economy .
#Text=You get people back to work , then we can quite fighting each other on these social issues .
#Text=Some of these social issues are accented because there 's a lot of unrest with the economy .

#Text=We need to worry about three things I think : getting the economy back right , getting out of these commitments like Afghanistan and dictators abroad , we need to get out of that , then we need to protect our civil liberties at home .
#Text=Those are the three main things that John Wolfe has on his agenda .
#Text=So I think those are the most important .
#Text=The economy is the most important .
#Text=And I think the economy ca n't be reformed until you reform the bank .

#Text=You noticed yesterday [ May 11 ] , JP Morgan lost two billion dollars because they 're pouring billions of dollars into all this speculation , and some of the credit default swaps and derivatives .
#Text=Well guess what ?
#Text=We 're underwriting that .
#Text=That 's casino capitalism .
#Text=I 've been talking about this all last year and all this year about how bad that 's getting .
#Text=Now , the chickens are coming home to roost .
#Text=That 's just JP Morgan .
#Text=We do n't know what the next bank is going to report .
#Text=We got to underwrite all that .
#Text=See , Obama 's never made an effort really to separate that out because he 's so ensconced in Wall Street money , and so persuaded by Wall Street advisers right there in the oval office .
#Text=He wo n't even go back to traditional banking to make these people separate casino capitalism from traditional banking .
#Text=He has n't done it .
#Text=As long as he does n't , we 're going to have to underwrite these things .
#Text=We 're going to have to keep bailing them out , bailing them out , bailing them out .
#Text=We should n't have to do that .
#Text=Obama ought to do something about that .
#Text=People want that done , but he ca n't do .
#Text=He 's handcuffed because he 's afraid of Wall Street .
